00040 #ifndef _graphicsmanager_h
00041 #define _graphicsmanager_h
00042 
00043 #include "crossplatformexport.h"
00044 #include "managerbase.h"

00046 namespace Ogre

00048     class Timer;

00052 class SDL_Surface;
00053 class SDL_Window;

00055 namespace phys
00056 {
00057     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00058     /// @class GraphicsSettings
00059     /// @headerfile graphicsmanager.h
00060     /// @brief This stores all the possible configuration options the graphics manager supports.
00061     /// @details The graphics manager stores one of these for all of it's configuration options,
00062     /// additionally one can be created and passed into the manager to set all the configuration
00063     /// options at once.
00064     ///////////////////////////////////////
00065     struct GraphicsSettings
00066     {
00067         /// @brief This stores the Height of the renderwindow
00068         Whole RenderHeight;
00069         /// @brief This stores the Width of the renderwindow
00070         Whole RenderWidth;
00071         /// @brief This is the desired state of whether the window is fullscreen or not.
00072         bool Fullscreen;
00073         /// @brief This is the desired state of whether to enable VSync or not.
00074         bool VSync;
00075         /// @brief Struct Constructor
00076         GraphicsSettings() : RenderHeight(0),RenderWidth(0),Fullscreen(false),VSync(false) {}
00077         GraphicsSettings& operator= (const GraphicsSettings &GS)
00078         {
00079             this->RenderHeight = GS.RenderHeight;
00080             this->RenderWidth = GS.RenderWidth;
00081             this->Fullscreen = GS.Fullscreen;
00082             this->VSync = GS.VSync;
00083             return *this;
00084         }
00085     };
00086 
00087     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00088     /// @class GraphicsManager
00089     /// @headerfile graphicsmanager.h
00090     /// @brief This is intended to store basic graphics setting for the user.
00091     /// @details This stores x/y resolution, fullscreen and in the future other
00092     /// settings. This is intended to make it easy for developers to pass/move around
00093     /// complex graphics settings. We hope to eventually include other items like
00094     /// shader settings, rendering API, and maybe other settings too.
00095     ///////////////////////////////////////
00096     class PHYS_LIB GraphicsManager: public ManagerBase
00097     {
00098         private:
00099             GraphicsSettings Settings;
00100 
00101             std::vector<String> SupportedResolutions;
00102             std::vector<String> SupportedDevices;
00103 
00104             /// @brief Adjust all Settings
00105             /// @param Width_ The desired width.
00106             /// @param Height_ The desired height.
00107             /// @param FullScreen_ True if fullscreen, false if not.
00108             /// @details This adjusts most data in this Graphics Settings and accepts new resolution and fullscreen settings. Be
00109             /// careful that the settings selected are appropriate. Many mobile devices do not support windows, and many screens
00110             /// do not support arbitrary resolutions in fullscreen mode.
00111             void Construct( const Whole &Width_, const Whole &Height_, const bool &FullScreen_);
00112 
00113             void CreateRenderWindow();
00114             void DestroyRenderWindow();
00115             void InitSDL();
00116             void ShutdownSDL();
00117             void InitViewportAndCamera();
00118             void UpdateWindowStats();
00119 
00120             Ogre::Timer* RenderTimer;
00121             Ogre::RenderWindow* OgreGameWindow;
00122             SDL_Surface* SDLscreen;
00123             SDL_Window* SDLwindow;
00124 
00125             Whole FrameDelay;
00126             bool SDLBeenInitialized;
00127             bool GraphicsInitialized;
00128 
00129         public:
00130             /// @brief Basic constructor
00131             /// @details This creates a basic Graphics Settings with resolution 640x480 with fullscreen set to false
00132             GraphicsManager();
00133 
00134             /// @brief Versatile Constructor
00135             /// @param Width_ The desired width.
00136             /// @param Height_ The desired height.
00137             /// @param FullScreen_ True if fullscreen, false if not.
00138             /// @details This creates a Graphics Settings with resolution and fullscreen passed into to it. Be careful that the
00139             /// settings selected are appropriate. Many mobile devices do not support windows, and many screens do not support
00140             /// arbitrary resolutions in fullscreen mode.
00141             GraphicsManager(const Whole &Width_, const Whole &Height_, const bool &FullScreen_);
00142 
00143             /// @brief Class Destructor.
00144             ~GraphicsManager();
00145 
00146             /// @brief Gets the Fullscreen Setting
00147             /// @details Gets the Fullscreen Setting
00148             /// @return This returns a bool, true if fullscreen is set, false otherwise
00149             bool getFullscreen() const;
00150 
00151             /// @brief Set the Fullscreen Setting
00152             /// @details Set the Fullscreen Setting
00153             /// @param Fullscreen_ This accepts a bool. True for fullscreen, false for windowed
00154             void setFullscreen(const bool &Fullscreen_);
00155 
00156             /// @brief Gets the Height of the Rendering Area
00157             /// @details Gets the Height of the Rendering Area
00158             /// @return This returns the Height of the Rendering Area
00159             Whole getRenderHeight() const;
00160 
00161             /// @brief Sets the Height.
00162             /// @details Set the Render Height inside the window in windowed mode, set the resolution of the screen in fullscreen
00163             /// @param Height_ This accepts a Whole.
00164             void setRenderHeight(const Whole &Height_);
00165 
00166             /// @brief Gets the Width of the Rendering Area
00167             /// @details Gets the Width of the Rendering Area
00168             /// @return This returns the Width of the Rendering Area
00169             Whole getRenderWidth() const;
00170 
00171             /// @brief Sets the Width.
00172             /// @details Set the Render Width inside the window in windowed mode, set the resolution of the screen in fullscreen
00173             /// @param Width_ This accepts a Whole.
00174             void setRenderWidth(const Whole &Width_);
00175 
00176             /// @brief Changes the X and Y Resolution at the same time
00177             /// @details This should be useful in situations where it is not possible to update the width and height separately.
00178             /// @param Width_ The new desired Width for the rendering area as a whole number
00179             /// @param Height_ The new desired Width for the rendering area as a whole number
00180             void setRenderResolution(const Whole &Width_, const Whole &Height_);
00181 
00182             /// @brief Changes the X Resolution, Y Resolution, and fullscreen at the same time
00183             /// @details This should be useful in situations where it is not possible to update all of the options separately.
00184             void setRenderOptions(const GraphicsSettings& NewSettings);
00185 
00186             /// @brief Gets whether or not SDL has been started.
00187             /// @return Returns a bool indicating whether or not SDL has been initialized yet.
00188             bool HasSDLBeenInitialized();
00189 
00190             /// @brief This Shows an Engine Generated Configuration Screen
00191             /// @details This could look like and could offer just about any option to the user. It is loosely expected to show Graphical Configuration
00192             /// options, like Vsync and Resolution, But it might ask some really silly stuff. I think this would be fine for smaller simpler apps
00193             /// Which have no other way to configure such things, but any sizable project should develop their own way to expose and manage
00194             /// user settings.
00195             bool ShowGraphicsSettingDialog();
00196 
00197             /// @brief Gets the FPS based on the last frame rendered.
00198             /// @details This essentially determines how many frames could be rendered if all
00199             /// frames within a second rendered at the same speed.
00200             /// @return Returns a Real representing the framerate.
00201             Real GetLastFPS();
00202 
00203             /// @brief Gets the Average FPS.
00204             /// @return Returns a Real representing the average framerate.
00205             Real GetAverageFPS();
00206 
00207             /// @brief Gets the Best FPS.
00208             /// @return Returns a Real representing the best framerate.
00209             Real GetBestFPS();
00210 
00211             /// @brief Gets the Worst FPS.
00212             /// @return Returns a Real representing the worst framerate.
00213             Real GetWorstFPS();
00214 
00215             /// @brief Gets the shortest amount of time it's taken to render a frame.
00216             /// @return Returns a Real representing the best time for rendering a frame.
00217             Real GetBestFrameTime();
00218 
00219             /// @brief Gets the longest amount of time it's taken to render a frame.
00220             /// @return Returns a Real representing the worst time for rendering a frame.
00221             Real GetWorstFrameTime();
00222 
00223             /// @brief Gets the name of the render system in current use.
00224             /// @return Returns a string containing the name of the current render system.
00225             String GetRenderSystemName();
00226 
00227             /// @brief Gets a vector containing all the resolutions supported by this render system on the current hardware.
00228             /// @details This vector is populated when the manager gets initialized.  Calling on it before then will give you an empty vector.
00229             /// @return Returns a Const Pointer to the vector storing all the supported resolutions.
00230             const std::vector<String>* GetSupportedResolutions();
00231 
00232             /// @brief Gets a vector containing all the devices supported by this render system on the current hardware.
00233             /// @details This vector is populated when the manager gets initialized.  Calling on it before then will give you an empty vector.
00234             /// @return Returns a Const Pointer to the vector storing all the supported devices.
00235             const std::vector<String>* GetSupportedDevices();
00236 
00237             /// @brief Resets the Render timer.
00238             /// @details This function should not be called unless you know exactly what you are doing.
00239             /// This will reset the timer keeping track of game frame times, and thus can disrupt functionality of the mainloop.
00240             virtual void ResetRenderTimer();
00241 
00242         //Inherited from ManagerBase
00243             /// @brief Empty Initializor
00244             /// @details This specific initializor is unneeded, but we implement it for compatibility. It also exists
00245             /// in case a derived class wants to override it for some reason
00246             virtual void Initialize();
00247 
00248             /// @brief This is where the rendering takes place.
00249             /// @details This does the rendering for the game using all the actors in the actormanager.
00250             virtual void DoMainLoopItems();
00251 
00252             /// @brief This returns the type of this manager.
00253             /// @return This returns ManagerTypeName::GraphicsManager
00254             virtual ManagerTypeName GetType() const;
00255 
00256             /// @brief This is derived from and uses the ManagerBase to perform the the post main loop callbacks
00257             /// @return This returns a true or false depending on what the callback returns
00258             virtual bool PostMainLoopItems();
00259         //Internal access functions
00260             /// @internal
00261             /// @brief This will set the stored pointer to the ogre render window.
00262             /// @details This function is called on once when constructing the world, should not be called otherwise.
00263             /// @param OgreWindow A pointer to the created Ogre RenderWindow class.
00264             void SetOgreWindowPointer(Ogre::RenderWindow* OgreWindow);
00265             /// @internal
00266             /// @brief This will get a pointer to the RenderWindow class in use by the world.
00267             /// @return Returns a pointer to the Ogre RenderWindow class in use.
00268             Ogre::RenderWindow* GetOgreWindowPointer();
00269     };
00270 }
00271 #endif
